reviews.title: Keep your receipt. They will over charge you!
reviews.text: Not a bad place, it was a quick trip, so just wanted a place to lay our head. We checked at this one and also the motel connected to it. The other one was $25.00 cheaper but didn't have a pool. I think it's crappy they didn't let both places use the pool. The motels are connected! So my kids wanted a pool so we opted for this one. They told me it would be $104.00 total for the room for 5 people and a pet for one night. My credit card was charged $115.00. So I called and they said that wasn't their problem! I would not recomend this unless you have extra money to just throw away!

reviews.title: 2nd trip was just as good as the first!
reviews.text: This was the second time we stayed at this hotel while visiting the American Pickers! Great stay again. First trip in December we had a hot tub room facing the river on the first floor. We had brought out dog and they allow pets, so it was perfect. This past weekend, we stayed on the second floor without a river view, but we were not in the room a lot, so it was no problems. If you have mobility issues, make sure you request a room on the first floor as there is not an elevator.

reviews.title: Great Place
reviews.text: Pool and whirlpool were great as well as the breakfast. Rooms were clean and the beds were comfy and the shower was nice. It was a hot weekend and the air kept up just fine and worked great to cool off when we needed it.

reviews.title: Clean comfortable & affordable with a view of the Mighty Mississippi
reviews.text: Some friends had them add a fridge to their room for $4 a night and they were happy with it. I also asked them to take the safe charge off my bill and they did it no problem. I didn't feel like we needed a safe as it was a nice hotel!

reviews.title: A great hotel
reviews.text: I will post some reviews from some resturants as well.

reviews.title: Loved it, perfect location!!
reviews.text: A group of us go to the TugFest each year. Usually we stay on the Illinois side, but this year we decided to try the Iowa side.

reviews.title: Good Comfort Inn
reviews.text: We loved the hotel, it was clean, had a pool and offered breakfast each morning. There is a McDonalds in front of the hotel, a fancy steak restaurant and German restaurant in walking distance and a grocery store.

reviews.title: Very nice Hotel
reviews.text: The best part we were only about 2 miles from downtown.

reviews.title: Early wake up but clean place
reviews.text: This Motel looks new. The building is attached to another Motel that is higher priced (we checked the price at both). The rooms are very clean. There is a good free breakfast though not as extensive as probably the expensive motel on the other end. The rooms are very clean and it is located in a same and pretty area. It is on a high hill that overlooks the river. The clerks were very friendly. And the small town that is very close has a few good places to eat. The "Pickers" antique store is located here. A good place to spend the night.

reviews.title: A great hotel in the Quad Cities
reviews.text: My husband and I chose to go to see the "Pickers" for our one night get away. We had a wonderful time . I would go back if I had the chance.

reviews.title: average run of the mill comfort inn
reviews.text: we're driving from MA to CA while our moving truck is moving all of our stuff. we have a dog and cat so we have to stay in hotels that accept pets (our dog is over 20 lbs so that rules out a bunch of options). we just wanted a clean, quiet place to spend our 7 nights on the road.

reviews.title: Great hotel!
reviews.text: this place was average. there were a couple of amenities that were added bonuses- the indoor pool and hot tub were nice. the front desk made chocolate chip cookies (yum!). breakfast was continental delux- nicer than other comfort inns we stayed at with more hot options (biscuits and gravy, scrambled eggs, sausage, breakfast burritos, etc.).

reviews.title: Nice, clean hotel
reviews.text: rooms were average in cleanliness, comfort, convenience.

reviews.title: Not luxury, but clean, nice location, friendly staff
reviews.text: We stayed here 2 nights at each end of our Twilight Cruise up the Mississippi. The staff was friendly, and check-in was easy. The room was spacious and clean. There was even a recliner. Breakfast was much better than you usually get at this type of hotel. They had biscuits and gravy, eggs, bacon, and burritos as well as all the usual breakfast food. The only drawback we experienced was the lack of elevator. We had stopped going to Choice Hotels years ago, but this one was so nice that I will consider them again. I definitely recommend this hotel.

reviews.title: Clean with a Beautiful View
reviews.text: This hotel is up on the hill from the Mississippi. I don't know if any of the rooms have a view of the river, ours did not. The check in was very quick, the room and bathroom was very clean. The morning breakfast was very good ...had choices of eggs, donuts, waffels, cereal, toast, bagels, bisquits and gravy,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here on our way to South Dakota in June. Arrived late, got the last non-smoking suite. More than we wanted to pay, but nonetheless, spotless, quiet, and very helpful staff. Next morning we drove down to the Mississippi River and stopped at the Iowa Welcome Center. If we hadn't been in a hurry, we would've leisurely strolled around. The Iowa Welcome Center is one of the best I've been in. It combines museum w/ shops and info center. Great concept! The Holiday Inn, right on the river, also looked very clean.
reviews.title: Very Clean, Nice location, Great Staff

reviews.text: Just five minutes down the road from Davenport, hides the small town of LeClaire. I've stayed often in the Quad Cities, and this time ventured out to the "suburbs". I'm glad I did. This hotel is far cleaner and better kept than any in the Quad Cities area. Some rooms face the Mississippi, others a wooded area. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Rooms were larger than most, and could easily accomodate families. It's next door to the Visitor's Center so it's easy to find! In town there are several antique shops, cafes, and a great western sytle restaurant.
reviews.title: Best in Quad Cities Area

reviews.text: Hope you enjoy this hotel as much as we did.
